page.title: 13Housing in Ripe
page.content: There are approximately 100 houses in Ripe and the part of Chalvington included in this block. They are mostly owner occupied apart from a few which are rented privately or by the council and two or three tied cottages. Most of the farms are run by the owners with help from farm workers who find their own accommodation. Houses in this area are expensive so to afford to live here the house owner usually has to commute to well paid work in town. There are many old farm houses and other attractive properties in the upper income bracket. Also farm labourers cottages built mainly in the 19th C. have been modernised and make good family homes. In the last 20 years the County policy has been to limit builing and only ten new houses have been built.
